WRITING.TEXT: Palpatine has a good reason IMO. The Sith are the enemy of the Jedi and his goal as a Sith was to destroy them and rule the galaxy. In a universe thats not already established it would be fine for Snoke to be just this evil entity but this is a continuation of a story. When I say good reason I mean not just a character that exists to be the bad guy but a character that has a reason to be there as part of a threaded storyline. He doesn't have to be related to or be a character we know from the previous movies but hopefully his motives will be rooted in a situation or incident from the past films. I.E. The Clone Wars, fall of the Republic, the Rebellion..etc.
I'm fine with that as long as he has a good reason for doing what he does

So on the Facebook group "Stephen King Collectors" someone gave away doubles of 2 Stephen King books he had in a contest. All you had to do was post a pic of your Stephen king collection and there was a random drawing for the winner. Well needless to say I won one of the books a 3rd edition of Skeleton Crew. However as I looked in the bottom of the package this was in in it. All things serve the beam!
